eu.amidst.core.inference

Class ImportanceSampling

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.amidst.core.inference.ImportanceSampling
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    InferenceAlgorithm, Serializable

    public class ImportanceSampling
extends Object
implements InferenceAlgorithm, Serializable
    This class implements the interface InferenceAlgorithm and defines the Importance Sampling algorithm. J.M. Hammersley and D.C. Handscomb. Monte Carlo Methods. Methuen and Co, London, UK, 1964.

    For an example of use follow this link http://amidst.github.io/toolbox/CodeExamples.html#isexample

    See Also:

      • setParallelMode

        public void setParallelMode(boolean parallelMode_)
        Sets the parallel mode for this InferenceAlgorithm. Note that this method is only implemented for the inference algorithms that can be run in parallel.
        Specified by:
        setParallelMode in interface InferenceAlgorithm
        Parameters:
        parallelMode_ - a boolean that indicates whether this InferenceAlgorithm can be run in parallel (i.e., true) or not (i.e., false).
